thread.section_title: Google Maps new update may mean you never get a parking ticket again – Metro
thread.title: Google Maps new update may mean you never get a parking ticket again
thread.title_full: Google Maps new update may mean you never get a parking ticket again

author: georgiadiebelius1
title: Google Maps new update may mean you never get a parking ticket again
text:
The new update is on its way (Picture: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images) Is there anything more annoying than getting back to your car after a long day and finding a parking ticket?
One of those bright yellow ‘Penalty Charge Notice’ stickers.
Theresa May visits victims of the London terror attack in hospital No, we don’t think so.
But thanks to Google Maps, parking tickets may be a thing of the past.
Yes, a few handy new features mean that you will be able to track your car, and therefore never lose it… ergo, never overstay your parking time.
Goodbye, old friend (Picture: Getty) Using location services on your phone, your car will be marked by a blue marker – so you will always know where it is.
You can also click to start a timer, meaning your phone will go off when you’re nearing the end of the time on your parking meter.
Family of murdered Pc Keith Palmer pay tribute to 'wonderful dad and husband' Sounds great right?
Sadly, the addition to the app is only currently available on Android – however if you’re that desperate you can always sign up to be a Beta tester.
You can do this by clicking on the Google Maps app on the Google Play store.
You’ll then be sent the Beta update, where you can then try out the all new features.
If you’re OK in holding off – the update should be with you by the end of the year.
